questions.text: Which of the following is the best indicator for efficiency for contraceptives?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pearls index It is the best indicator for efficiency of contraceptives.

Highyeild:

Pearl index : it is defined as the number of contraceptive failures per 100 women years of exposure. It is described in human women years (HWY). Pearl Index = total accidental pregnancies X 1200/total months of exposure. It is the most common indicator used to measure contraceptive failure.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B. Sullivan Index : it refers to “expectation of life free of disability”. SI = Life Expectancy. Duration of disability and inability to do major activities. Option A. Couple protection rate : it is the percentage of eligible couples effectively protected from childbirth by one or other approved methods of contraception. Attaining 60% CPR means restricting all third and high order births. Option D. Abortion rates : It is the number of abortions per 1000 women in the reproductive age group(15-45).

Solution:

Standard Deviation The above formula gives the standard deviation. Standard deviation measures the spread of data around the mean.

Highyeild:

The above formula gives the standard deviation. Standard deviation measures the spread of data around the mean. It is a square root of variance. A low SD means the data is close to mean while a high SD indicates the data is more spread out. Formula on the left is used if the sample is >30.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Standard error is calculated using the formula SD/sqrt(n), where SD is the standard deviation and n is the sample size. Increasing the sample size decreases the standard error. Option C . Variance measures how much the data points deviate from the mean, with larger variance indicating greater spread of the data. It is calculated as the average of the squared deviation scores of the distribution. Option D. The median is the value that divides a frequency distribution in half when all scores are listed in order. It is the middle value for distributions with an odd number of elements and the average of the two middle scores for distributions with an even number of elements.

questions.text: Match the following with the scientist contribution: Choose the correct options?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-3, B-1, C-2

Highyeild:

Walter Reed showed yellow fever is transmitted by the ades. Edward Jenner discovered smallpox vaccination James Lind - prevention of scurvy with citrus fruits.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: 34 weeks pregnant woman with mild to moderate anemia, which of the following is used for treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: 2 doses od of oral iron + IV iron sucrose

options.label: B
options.text: IV Iron sucrose if not able to tolerate oral

options.label: C
options.text: IM ferric carboxy maltose if not able to tolerate oral

questions.correct_answer: B. IV Iron sucrose if not able to tolerate oral
questions.explanation:
Solution:

IV Iron sucrose if not able to tolerate oral

Highyeild:

Pregnant woman with mild- moderate anaemia is treated with: Two IFA tablets orally daily. IV iron sucrose or ferric carboxy maltose , in cases of anemia detected late in pregnancy, or unable to tolerate oral iron or poor compliance. Based on ICMR, anaemia is divided into the following: Mild 10-10.9gm% Moderate 7-9.9gm% Severe <7gm% Very Severe <4gm% Management of iron deficiency anaemia in pregnancy: Oral preparation s : The dose is approximately 180-200 mg of elemental iron per day (equivalent to 3 tablets).The treatment is continued until blood parameters return to normal levels. The reticulocyte count is the earliest indicator of improvement. After that, a maintenance dose of one tablet per day is taken. The maintenance dose should be continued throughout the pregnancy and for three months after delivery to replenish iron stores. Parenteral preparation : Parenteral iron is indicated in patients on hemo/peritoneal dialysis, malabsorption syndrome, and pregnant females with severe anaemia that is seen for the first time during the last 8-10 weeks. The rise in haemoglobin concentration after parenteral therapy is similar to that with oral iron , approximately 7 to 1 gm % per week . Parenteral iron is not given for a rapid rise in haemoglobin concentration. The main advantage of parenteral therapy over oral iron is the certainty of administration. Indications of Blood Transfusion: Severe anaemia seen beyond 36 weeks of pregnancy. Anaemia due to active blood loss. Refractory anemia. Associated infection.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

We use oral iron preparations till 30 weeks , and parenteral preparation in 30-36 weeks and blood transfusion after 36 weeks. Note: Hb% should be more than 7 at the time of delivery.

questions.text: The water is collected from a broken septic tank and larva breed was obtained. Identify the breed of the mosquito:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Culex mosquito The mosquito given in the image, which grows in dirty water is Culex.

Highyeild:

Culex mosquitoes act as a vector for filariasis, japanese encephalitis and west nile fever. It breeds in dirty water collections.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Aedes mosquito acts as a vector for dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, filariasis and Zika virus. It breeds in artificial collections of water. Option C. Anopheles mosquito transmits malaria and filaria. It usually breeds in clean water. Option D. Mansonia mosquito is the vector for malayan filariasis and breeds in water bodies containing aquatic vegetation.

questions.text: Image of the following is used in which of the following diseases?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Malaria The given image shows artemisinin-based combination therapy which is used in the treatment of falciparum malaria.

Highyeild:

ACT consists of artesunate given for 3 days and sulphadoxine-pyrimethamine given for 1 day. It is provided under the national vector-borne disease control program (NVBDCP).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Artemether-lumefantrine is used for the treatment of falciparum malaria in the north-eastern states.

questions.text: Match the following with the correct answers: Choose the correct options
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A3, B4, C1, D2

Highyeild:

The period of prepathogenesis refers to the period before the onset of the disease . Interaction between the agent, host and the environment occurs in this stage. Primary prevention is applicable during this phase. Pathogenesis refers to the period when the disease process has started. The period between exposure and onset of clinical signs and symptoms is termed as the incubation period. The onset of clinical signs and symptoms marks the clinical phase of the disease. Natural history of the disease refers to the natural course of the disease without any intervention. Rehabilitation is a part of tertiary prevention. Use of various measures for training the individual to the highest level of functional ability.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: After an earthquake, there was a change of building codes to earthquake-resistant buildings. Which of the following steps of disaster management can this event be classified as?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mitigation The measures taken to prevent disasters from causing emergencies or to lessen the likely effects of emergencies are considered as disaster mitigation.

Highyeild:

Steps of disaster management: Response - Response is defined as the actions taken to decrease mortality and morbidity, and to prevent further property damage when the hazard occurs. Recovery - Recovery is defined as the actions taken to return to normal following an event such as repairing buildings, replacing homes. Mitigation/prevention - Prevention/Mitigation is defined as “sustained actions that decrease the risk of a hazard (probability of occurrence) or to reduce the potential negative consequences suffered by people and/or property.” Preparedness - Preparedness takes the form of plans or procedures designed to minimise physical and property damage when an event occurs. These activities ensure that when a disaster strikes, disaster (emergency) managers will be able to provide the best response possible.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: An individual presents with a large wound from a dog bite which is bleeding. Consider the following options: Clean the wound with soap and water for 10-15 minutes Two doses of equine rabies immunoglobulin at the rate of 40 IU/kg Anti-rabies vaccine, intramuscular - doses on day 0, 3, 7, 14, 28 Cover the wound with sterile dressings and tight bandage Loose wound suturing with a proper dressing Which of the above statements is/ are correct?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2, 3, 5

Highyeild:

Measures taken after a dog bite: Clean the wound with soap and water for 10-15 minutes. Disinfectant can be applied after drying the wound. Bite wounds are not sutured generally . If unavoidable, loose suturing can be done after giving rabies immunoglobulin in and around the bite wound. Anti rabies vaccine : IM doses on day 0, 3, 7, 14 and 28. Single dose of rabies immunoglobulin at 40 IU/kg is given to all category III wounds.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: How much population does an ASHA cater to in a rural setting?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1000

Highyeild:

ASHA is an Accredited Social Health Activist. General norm of selection is 1 ASHA for 1000 population or can be relaxed to 1 habitation in hilly areas. ASHA must primarily be a woman resident of the village married/widowed/divorced, preferably in the age group of 25 to 45 years . Should be 10 th pass . Adequate representation from the disadvantaged groups will ensure to serve those groups better. She is supposed to get 23 days training by ANM and AWW. She is appointed by the Village Panchayat and has to report to them.

Extraedge:

The ASHAs will receive performance-based incentives for promoting universal immunisation , referral and escort services for Reproductive & Child Health (RCH) and other healthcare programmes, and construction of household toilets.

questions.text: Mortality is taken into consideration in which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Net reproduction rate (NRR) Net Reproduction Rate is the total number of girl children born to a woman in entire reproductive lifespan taking into account their mortality.

Highyeild:

Total fertility rate in a specific year is defined as the total number of children that would be born to each woman if she were to live to the end of her child-bearing years and give birth to children in alignment with the prevailing age-specific fertility rates. TFR in India is 2.2 and the goal is to reach 2.1 and NRR will become 1 and the population of India is likely to be stable by 2045.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Gross reproduction Rate is the average number of daughters a woman would bear in her life if she experiences the age specific fertility rates(for daughters). It roughly equals to half of TFR. Option C. Total fertility Rate is defined as the average number of children that would be born to a woman if she experiences the current fertility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-49 years). According to NFHS 5 present TFR of India is 2(Urban 1.6 and Rural 2.1). Option D. Completed family size is the total number of children borne by a woman during her child bearing age(15-49 years).

questions.text: Which among the following is disposed of in white container?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sharp waste Sharp waste is disposed of in puncture proof, leak proof, tamper proof white (translucent)containers.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Anatomical waste is disposed of in a yellow non chlorinated plastic bag/container. Option C. Glassware is disposed of in cardboard boxes with blue coloured marking. Option D. Plastic waste is disposed of in a red non chlorinated plastic bag/container.

questions.text: Students of a boarding school developed abdominal pain, jaundice and fever. Which of the following parameters would you investigate to get to a diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

lgM for Hepatitis A lgM for Hepatitis A as the onset of disease in the given question is acute. Options B, C and D are false.

Highyeild:

Hepatitis A infection is caused by the hepatitis A virus (HAV). Humans are the only known reservoir. HAV infection is usually a self-limited illness that does not become chronic. HAV is usually transmitted by the faecal-oral route (either via person-to-person contact or consumption of contaminated food or water.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Hepatitis A - MC in children spreading through feco oral route. Hepatitis E - MC in adults spreading through feco oral route. IgM is a marker of acute infection whereas IgG marks a chronic state.

questions.text: Thickness of lead apron recommended for a staff for radiation protection is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0.5 mm

Highyeild:

Lead apron thickness: 0.25mm - Useful for Mammography 0.50mm - Most widely used . It is able to attenuate >90% of scattered radiation. 1.00mm - Very heavy for daily use but used in pregnant women to cover the abdomen.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and C are false.
